results.title: Europa nostra
results.creator_credit: Charles Mapleston, Peter Bradford and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: Shot in fifteen countries in Western and Eastern Europe, this film touches upon all aspects of conservation, including: treasures lost, restoration, new uses for old buildings, traffic, pressures of tourism, unsightly advertising, and the activities of local authorities and conservation authorities.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Mapleston, Peter Bradford and World Wide Pictures

results.title: Europa Europa
results.creator_credit: Agnieszka Holland, Arthur Brauner, Filmkunst and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description: A movie that proves that fact is far more bizarre than fiction. Based on the autobiography of Solomon Perel, “Europa Europa” follows the extraordinary adventures of a Jewish boy becomes one of the prize pupils in the Hitler Youth. Young Solomon’s attempts to evade the Nazi slaughter of the Jews is a tragi-comedy of epic porportions. While the war escalates in horror and intensity, Solomon relies on his good looks and sharp wits to survive. From Communist training camp to the elite Nazi school in Berlin, Solomon’s journey takes him across Germany, Poland and Eastern Europe. “Europa Europa” is such an exhilerating movie to watch - fast, colourful, exciting - it is only on reflection that the full resonance of Solomon’s story has its effect. His chameleon changes of self in order to survive undermine both radical and humanist notions of the “hero” and the film asks unsettling and difficult questions about complicity and collaboration in violence. This film is alive: one moment we are laughing out loud at Solomon’s attempts to hide his penis from view (and its telling lack of foreskin) and in the next moment we confront the stark inhuman obscenity of the Warsaw Ghetto. A rivetting, important, complex film.

results.title: Europa
results.brief_description: Animated film giving thumb-nail description of the history of Europe. It then switches to a summary of the federation movement in the United States and its advantages. Concludes by pointing to potential future advantages of a European Community movement.

results.title: Eureka stockade
results.creator_credit: Harry Watt, Leslie Norman, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description: In 1854, the government instigated moves designed to drive the gold miners from Eureka Hill goldfields. The miners showed their opposition to the move by revolting. The legendary leader Peter Lalor is portrayed by Chips Rafferty. Cast includes: Peter Finch, Jane Barrett, Jack Lambert, Gordon Jackson.

results.title: Eureka
results.brief_description: Highly commended entry into the “Make a stamp come alive” category of Screen It! This film recounts the story of famous revolt in Ballarat and the subsequent discovery of gold. An animated short entered to ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Eureka
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Jeremy Thomas, Recorded Picture Company and J F Productions
results.brief_description: This is the dramatic story of the anticlimactic life of a greedy gold prospector after he has struck it rich. Gene Hackman performs with credit as a man whose jackpot fortune leaves him bored, surly and paranoid of being exploited by everybody, including his family. Jane Lapotaire plays his alcoholic wife and Theresa Russell his woman-daughter who rebelliously marries a man her father sees only as a merciless fortune hunter. This is an unforgettable tale of the illusory nature of power and the all-consuming violence of possession - whether it be of love or gold. Based on a book by Marshall Houts.

results.title: Eureka
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Peach’s gold”.
Through dramatised re-enactments, as well as historical footage, Bill Peach traces the events which led to the dramatic confrontation at the Eureka stockade, one of the key incidents in Australian political history. He investigates the issues behind the uprising between the miners, the police and the army caused by harsh and expensive licensing systems and describes how long-term effects eventually led to the introduction of safer and fairer working conditions.

results.title: Euphronius painted: Krater of Heracles and Antaeus ...
results.creator_credit: Alain Jaubert, Pascal Vimenet, Delta Image, La Sept, FR3 and Musée du Louvre
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Palettes”.
The krater of Heracles and Antaeus describes a famous fight in Greek mythology. It is one of the most beautiful pieces in the Louvre Museum and is signed by Euphronius, a painter whose refined style can be found on numerous objects around 510 B.C. when a pictorial change came to pass. The program describes the krater in detail, explains Athenian ceramic techniques and something of the life of Euphronius.
results.title_for_label: Euphronius painted: Krater of Heracles and Antaeus …

results.title: Euphoria
results.brief_description: A group of high school students navigate love and friendships in a world of drugs, sex, trauma, and social media.

constellations_other.name: If at first you don't succeed
constellations_other.description: Though originally intended as a laugh, Celeste Baber’s social media posts have become examples of body positivity to her eight million followers and challenge the absurd expectations put on women in society.
